text: Florentin Crihălmeanu (17 September 1959 – 12 January 2021) was a Romanian Greek Catholic hierarch. He was born in Iași, Romania. He became a priest in September 1990. He was named auxiliary bishop of the Cluj-Gherla Diocese in November 1996 by Pope John Paul II. In 2002, he became Bishop of Cluj-Gherla. PS Florentin Crihălmeanu at the Romanian Church United with Rome, Greek- Catholic site; accessed May 28, 2012 Crihălmeanu died on 12 January 2021 of COVID-19 in Cluj-Napoca, Romania at the age of 61. Horea Stoica, “A murit episcopul Florentin Crihălmeanu, infectat cu Covid-19”, Știri de Cluj; January 12, 2021 ==References== Category:1959 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Romania Category:Romanian people Category:Eastern Catholic bishops
title: Florentin Crihălmeanu
